intro: Hieracium britanniciforme, commonly known as the British dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and heart-shaped basal leaves. The plant is native to Europe and has been introduced to other regions, including North America. It thrives in a variety of habitats, including meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils. Hieracium britanniciforme is often found growing in clusters, with a robust root system that allows it to spread easily.
